query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Quando si parte il gioco de la zara, 2 colui che perde si riman dolente, 3 repetendo le volte, e tristo impara;
query.error: **English:** 1 When the game of dice begins, 2 the one who loses remains sorrowful, 3 repeating the throws, and sadly learns;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Tal era io in quella turba spessa, 11 volgendo a loro, e qua e là, la faccia, 12 e promettendo mi sciogliea da essa.
query.error: **English:** 10 Such was I in that thick crowd, 11 turning my face to them, here and there, 12 and promising myself to be freed from it.
query.result: 10 Tathā aham āsītām samūhe ghanasya, 11 Vakram iva teṣām prati, atra atra, vaktram, 12 Evaṃ ca ātmānam vimokṣyāmi iti pratijñām kṛtvā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Quiv’ era l’Aretin che da le braccia 14 fiere di Ghin di Tacco ebbe la morte, 15 e l’altro ch’annegò correndo in caccia.
query.error: **English:** 13 Here was the Aretine who from the arms 14 of fierce Ghino di Tacco met his death, 15 and the other who drowned while running in the chase.
query.result: 13 Atraiva āsīt Aretinaḥ yaḥ Ghinena Taccena 14 bhujābhyām ugraiḥ mṛtyum prāpa, 15 anyaśca yaḥ mṛgayāyāṃ dhāvati nimajjata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Quivi pregava con le mani sporte 17 Federigo Novello, e quel da Pisa 18 che fé parer lo buon Marzucco forte.
query.error: **English:** 16 There Frederick Novello prayed with outstretched hands, 17 and he of Pisa who made the good Marzucco seem strong.
query.result: 16 Tatrāñjaliputaḥ prārthayām āsa 17 Federigo Novello, sa ca Pīśavāsaḥ 18 yaḥ śreṣṭham Marzukkam balavataraṃ darśayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Vidi conte Orso e l’anima divisa 20 dal corpo suo per astio e per inveggia, 21 com’ e’ dicea, non per colpa commisa;
query.error: **English:** 19 I saw Count Orso and his soul divided 20 from his body through hatred and envy, 21 as he said, not for any fault committed;
query.result: 19 Apaśyam aham Orsoṃ ca tathaiva tasya jīvaṃ 20 Dehaṃ parityajantaṃ dveṣeṇa ca mātsaryeṇa ca, 21 Yathā sa āha, na tu kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ kena cit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Pier da la Broccia dico; e qui proveggia, 23 mentr’ è di qua, la donna di Brabante, 24 sì che però non sia di peggior greggia.
query.error: **English:** 22 I mean Pierre de la Brosse; and let the lady of Brabant 23 take heed, while she is still on this side, 24 so that she may not be of a worse flock.
query.result: 22 Pier da la Brocciaṃ vadāmi; atraiva ca vicārayet, 23 Yāvad atraiva asti, Brabanteśvarī, 24 Yathā na bhavet sāpi ghaṭīyasasya vṛndasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Come libero fui da tutte quante 26 quell’ ombre che pregar pur ch’altri prieghi, 27 sì che s’avacci lor divenir sante,
query.error: **English:** 25 As soon as I was free from all those 26 shades who prayed only that others might pray, 27 so that they might hasten to become holy,
query.result: 25 Yathā aham vimuktaḥ abhavam sarvābhyaḥ 26 tābhyaḥ chāyābhyaḥ yāḥ prārthayanti eva yathā anye prārthayantu, 27 yathā tāḥ śīghram bhavantu puṇyāḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 io cominciai: «El par che tu mi nieghi, 29 o luce mia, espresso in alcun testo 30 che decreto del cielo orazion pieghi;
query.error: **English:** 28 I began: "It seems that you deny me, 29 O my light, as is stated explicitly in some text, 30 that a decree of heaven can be swayed by pious prayers;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 e questa gente prega pur di questo: 32 sarebbe dunque loro speme vana, 33 o non m’è ’l detto tuo ben manifesto?».
query.error: **English:** 31 and these people pray only for this: 32 would their hope then be in vain, 33 or is your statement not clear to me?"
query.result: 31 evaṃ ca ete janāḥ etasya eva prārthanāṃ kurvanti: 32 ataḥ kim etāṃ prati teṣāṃ āśā mithyā syāt, 33 atha vā mama tava uktam na suṣpaṣṭam asti?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 ché cima di giudicio non s’avvalla 38 perché foco d’amor compia in un punto 39 ciò che de’ sodisfar chi qui s’astalla;
query.error: **English:** 37 for the summit of judgment is not lowered 38 because the fire of love accomplishes in an instant 39 that which should satisfy him who settles here;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 e là dov’ io fermai cotesto punto, 41 non s’ammendava, per pregar, difetto, 42 perché ’l priego da Dio era disgiunto.
query.error: **English:** 40 and there where I fixed that point, 41 no defect was amended by prayer, 42 because the prayer was disjoined from God.
query.result: 40 Tatra ca yatra aham sthāpayāmi etad lakṣyam, 41 Na nivāryate doṣaḥ prārthanayā, 42 Yataḥ prārthanā Devāt praviyuktā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Veramente a così alto sospetto 44 non ti fermar, se quella nol ti dice 45 che lume fia tra ’l vero e lo ’ntelletto.
query.error: **English:** 43 Truly, do not stop at such high suspicion, 44 if she does not tell you, 45 who will be a light between the truth and the intellect.
query.result: 43 Tathāpi tathāvidhe utkaṭe śaṅkāyāṃ 44 Na tiṣṭha, yadi sā na vakti tava, 45 Yā bhāvitrī satyārthayoḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Non so se ’ntendi: io dico di Beatrice; 47 tu la vedrai di sopra, in su la vetta 48 di questo monte, ridere e felice».
query.error: **English:** 46 I don't know if you understand: I speak of Beatrice; 47 you will see her above, on the summit 48 of this mountain, laughing and happy."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 E io: «Segnore, andiamo a maggior fretta, 50 ché già non m’affatico come dianzi, 51 e vedi omai che ’l poggio l’ombra getta».
query.error: **English:** 49 And I: "Sir, let us go with greater haste, 50 for I am not as weary as I was before, 51 and you see that the mountain is already casting its shadow."
query.result: 49 Aham ca: "Bhoḥ, gacchāvaḥ adhikam tvarayā, 50 na hy adya me śramaḥ pūrvavad asti, 51 paśyasi ca adhunā parvataḥ chāyāṃ prayacchati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 «Noi anderem con questo giorno innanzi», 53 rispuose, «quanto più potremo omai; 54 ma ’l fatto è d’altra forma che non stanzi.
query.error: **English:** 52 "We will go forward with this day before us," 53 he replied, "as much as we can; 54 but the fact is different from what you think.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Prima che sie là sù, tornar vedrai 56 colui che già si cuopre de la costa, 57 sì che ’ suoi raggi tu romper non fai.
query.error: **English:** 55 Before he is up there, you will see returning 56 the one who is already hiding behind the mountain, 57 so that you do not break his rays.
query.result: 55 Pūrvam yas tu adhastād adhunā vartate, 56 Sa eva punaḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ prādurbhāviṣyati, 57 Yathā tvam tasya raśmīn na bhindyāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Ma vedi là un’anima che, posta 59 sola soletta, inverso noi riguarda: 60 quella ne ’nsegnerà la via più tosta».
query.error: **English:** 58 But see there a soul who, placed 59 alone all alone, looks toward us: 60 she will teach us the most arduous way."
query.result: 58 Api tu paśya tatraikātmānam, sthitām 59 ekākīnirantaraṃ, asmābhiḥ pratirikṣamāṇām: 60 sā asmān bodhayiṣyati mārgaṃ durgamaṃ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Venimmo a lei: o anima lombarda, 62 come ti stavi altera e disdegnosa 63 e nel mover de li occhi onesta e tarda!
query.error: **English:** 61 We came to her: oh Lombard soul, 62 how you stand haughty and disdainful, 63 and in the movement of your eyes, dignified and slow!
query.result: 61 Āgamāma tatas tāṃ: he lombardikātmāṃ, 62 katham tvam tiṣṭhasi garvitā nirākāriṇī ca, 63 netracalanena ca mṛditā mandā ca!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Ella non ci dicëa alcuna cosa, 65 ma lasciavane gir, solo sguardando 66 a guisa di leon quando si posa.
query.error: **English:** 64 She did not say anything to us, 65 but let us go, only looking 66 like a lion when it settles down.
query.result: 64 Sā naḥ kaścid api na avocat, 65 kim tu gantum asmān anujānāti sma, kevalam avalokayantī 66 siṃhasyeva viśrāntiṃ kurvataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Pur Virgilio si trasse a lei, pregando 68 che ne mostrasse la miglior salita; 69 e quella non rispuose al suo dimando,
query.error: **English:** 67 Even Virgil drew near to her, praying 68 that she would show us the best way up; 69 and she did not answer his request,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 ma di nostro paese e de la vita 71 ci ’nchiese; e ’l dolce duca incominciava 72 «Mantüa . . . », e l’ombra, tutta in sé romita,
query.error: **English:** 70 but asked us about our country and our life; 71 and the gentle leader began, 72 "Mantua . . . ", and the shade, all withdrawn in itself,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 surse ver’ lui del loco ove pria stava, 74 dicendo: «O Mantoano, io son Sordello 75 de la tua terra!»; e l’un l’altro abbracciava.
query.error: **English:** 73 rose towards him from the place where it had been standing, 74 saying: "O Mantuan, I am Sordello 75 from your land!"; and they embraced each other.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Ahi serva Italia, di dolore ostello, 77 nave sanza nocchiere in gran tempesta, 78 non donna di province, ma bordello!
query.error: **English:** 76 Alas, Italy, hostel of grief, 77 ship without a helmsman in a great tempest, 78 not lady of provinces, but a brothel!
query.result: 76 Ahaṃ sarvāyaṃ bhārataṃ duḥkhaśālā, 77 nāvaḥ anāvikaḥ mahāntyaṃ tufāne, 78 na pradeśānāṃ strī, kintu veśyāgṛhaṃ!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Quell’ anima gentil fu così presta, 80 sol per lo dolce suon de la sua terra, 81 di fare al cittadin suo quivi festa;
query.error: **English:** 79 That noble soul was so ready, 80 just for the sweet sound of his native land, 81 to make a feast for his fellow citizens here;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 e ora in te non stanno sanza guerra 83 li vivi tuoi, e l’un l’altro si rode 84 di quei ch’un muro e una fossa serra.
query.error: **English:** 82 and now in you your living inhabitants are not without war, 83 and one gnaws at the other, 84 of those whom one wall and one moat enclose.
query.result: 82 atha tvayi na tiṣṭhanti vinā yuddhena 83 jīvāḥ tava, parasparaṃ ca khādanti 84 yeṣāṃ ekaḥ prākāraḥ ekaś ca parikhā āvarayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Cerca, misera, intorno da le prode 86 le tue marine, e poi ti guarda in seno, 87 s’alcuna parte in te di pace gode.
query.error: **English:** 85 Look, O wretched one, around the shores 86 of your seas, and then look within yourself, 87 if any part of you enjoys peace.
query.result: 85 Paśya, daridre, paritaḥ pṛthivyāḥ 86 samudrāṇāṃ tīreṣu, tataśca ātmānam antarīkṣe paśya, 87 yadi te śāntiḥ asti kaścid deśaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Che val perché ti racconciasse il freno 89 Iustinïano, se la sella è vòta? 90 Sanz’ esso fora la vergogna meno.
query.error: **English:** 88 What use is it for you to mend the bridle, 89 Justinian, if the saddle is empty? 90 Without it, the shame would be less.
query.result: 88 Kimartham tvām viśrāmyatām aśvasya 89 Yasyāsanastham na paśyāmi Justīnam? 90 Asmin vinā lajjāpi na syāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Ahi gente che dovresti esser devota, 92 e lasciar seder Cesare in la sella, 93 se bene intendi ciò che Dio ti nota,
query.error: **English:** 91 Ah, people who should be devout, 92 and let Caesar sit in the saddle, 93 if you rightly understand what God notes for you,
query.result: 91 Aha janaḥ yaḥ bhaktaḥ bhavitum arhasi, 92 caesarṃ ca āsanādhiṣṭhāpayitum, 93 yadi samyak jānāsi yat devaḥ tava nimittaṃ likhati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 guarda come esta fiera è fatta fella 95 per non esser corretta da li sproni, 96 poi che ponesti mano a la predella.
query.error: **English:** 94 see how this beast has become wicked 95 for not being corrected by the spurs, 96 since you put your hand to the bridle.
query.result: 94 paśya ayam mṛgaḥ katham durācāraḥ kṛtaḥ 95 aṅkuśair na niyamitaḥ iti, 96 yataḥ tvam lagāmaṃ hastena gṛhītavān asi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 O Alberto tedesco ch’abbandoni 98 costei ch’è fatta indomita e selvaggia, 99 e dovresti inforcar li suoi arcioni,
query.error: **English:** 97 O German Albert who abandon 98 this one who is made untamed and savage, 99 and you should mount her saddle,
query.result: 97 He Alberto jarmanikaḥ yaḥ parityajasi 98 imāṃ yā kṛtā adamyā ca āraṇyakī ca, 99 yaśca arhati āruhya tasyāḥ prṣṭhaṃ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 giusto giudicio da le stelle caggia 101 sovra ’l tuo sangue, e sia novo e aperto, 102 tal che ’l tuo successor temenza n’aggia!
query.error: **English:** 100 may just judgment fall from the stars 101 upon your blood, and may it be new and open, 102 such that your successor may have fear of it!
query.result: 100 nyāyyātmikā daṇḍanītiḥ patatu nakṣatrebhyaḥ 101 tava rakta upari, ca astu navī ca prakāśitā ca, 102 yathā tava uttara-adhikārī bhayam tatra kurvīta!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Ch’avete tu e ’l tuo padre sofferto, 104 per cupidigia di costà distretti, 105 che ’l giardin de lo ’mperio sia diserto.
query.error: **English:** 103 What have you and your father suffered, 104 out of greed, being constrained on this side, 105 that the garden of the empire is deserted?
query.result: 103 Kim tvam ca tava pitṛ ca abhūtam duḥkham, 104 lobhena atra niyamitau, 105 yena samrājyasyopāvanam śūnyam astu?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Vieni a veder Montecchi e Cappelletti, 107 Monaldi e Filippeschi, uom sanza cura: 108 color già tristi, e questi con sospetti!
query.error: **English:** 106 Come and see the Montagues and Capulets, 107 Monaldi and Filippeschi, men without care: 108 those already sad, and these suspicious!
query.result: 106 Ehi, āgaccha, paśya Montecchi-kulaṃ Cappelletti-kulaṃ ca, 107 Monaldi-kulaṃ Filippeschi-kulaṃ ca, naraṃ nirapekṣam: 108 te ca pūrvam eva duḥkhitāḥ, ete ca śaṅkitāḥ!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Vien, crudel, vieni, e vedi la pressura 110 d’i tuoi gentili, e cura lor magagne; 111 e vedrai Santafior com’ è oscura!
query.error: **English:** 109 Come, cruel one, come and see the oppression 110 of your nobles, and heal their suffering; 111 and you will see how dark Santafior is!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Vieni a veder la tua Roma che piagne 113 vedova e sola, e dì e notte chiama: 114 «Cesare mio, perché non m’accompagne?».
query.error: **English:** 112 Come and see your Rome that weeps, 113 widowed and alone, and day and night she calls out: 114 "My Caesar, why do you not accompany me?".
query.result: 112 Ehi, āgaccha, paśya tava Rāmam, yā rudati 113 vidhavā ekākini ca, aharniśam ca āha: 114 "Mama Cezara, kimartham na mama sārdhaṃ bhavatīti?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Vieni a veder la gente quanto s’ama! 116 e se nulla di noi pietà ti move, 117 a vergognar ti vien de la tua fama.
query.error: **English:** 115 Come and see how much people love each other! 116 And if no pity for us moves you, 117 come to be ashamed of your fame.
query.result: 115 Ehi paśya janaḥ katham parasparam premaṇā yuktāḥ santi! 116 Api ca yadi asmākaṃ viṣaye tava ko'pi dayā na jāyate, 117 tadā tava kīrter lakṣaṇāyā lajjāṃ prāpnuhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 E se licito m’è, o sommo Giove 119 che fosti in terra per noi crucifisso, 120 son li giusti occhi tuoi rivolti altrove?
query.error: **English:** 118 And if it is permissible for me, O supreme Jove, 119 who were crucified on earth for us, 120 are your just eyes turned elsewhere?
query.result: 118 Evaṃ ca yadi me samīcīnam, he parama-īśvara, 119 yaḥ asmākaṃ hetoḥ pṛthivyāṃ śūle āropitaḥ āsīt, 120 tava nyāyyāḥ dṛṣṭayaḥ anyatra pravṛttāḥ santi?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 O è preparazion che ne l’abisso 122 del tuo consiglio fai per alcun bene 123 in tutto de l’accorger nostro scisso?
query.error: **English:** 121 Or is it a preparation that you make in the abyss 122 of your counsel for some good 123 that is completely hidden from our understanding?
query.result: 121 Api vā tava manasāṃ niravadhi-gambhīre kuṭṭane 122 kaścid viśeṣaḥ śubha-hetur abhyupagamyate, 123 yaḥ asmākaṃ jñāna-śakti-vyāpārāt sarvathā viyuktaḥ asti?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ché le città d’Italia tutte piene 125 son di tiranni, e un Marcel diventa 126 ogne villan che parteggiando viene.
query.error: **English:** 124 For all the cities of Italy are full 125 of tyrants, and every peasant who joins a faction 126 becomes a new Marcellus.
query.result: 124 Yataḥ asmākaṃ bhārata-varṣasya sarvāṇi nagarāṇi 125 rākṣasair āpūritāni santi, yaś ca kaścid grāmyaḥ puruṣaḥ pakṣa-pātam āgacchati, 126 sa eva marcellus-saṃjño bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Fiorenza mia, ben puoi esser contenta 128 di questa digression che non ti tocca, 129 mercé del popol tuo che si argomenta.
query.error: **English:** 127 My Florence, you can be well content 128 with this digression that does not touch you, 129 thanks to your people who strive.
query.result: 127 Mama Fiorentina, śobhanā tvam eva bhavitum arhasi 128 Asya digressionasya yattvam na spr̥śati, 129 Tava janasya kṛpayā yaḥ prayatate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Molti han giustizia in cuore, e tardi scocca 131 per non venir sanza consiglio a l’arco; 132 ma il popol tuo l’ha in sommo de la bocca.
query.error: **English:** 130 Many have justice in their hearts, and it shoots forth late 131 so as not to come to the bow without counsel; 132 but your people have it on the tip of their tongues.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Molti rifiutan lo comune incarco; 134 ma il popol tuo solicito risponde 135 sanza chiamare, e grida: «I’ mi sobbarco!».
query.error: **English:** 133 Many refuse the common burden; 134 but your people, eager, respond 135 without being called, and cry: "I take it upon myself!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Or ti fa lieta, ché tu hai ben onde: 137 tu ricca, tu con pace e tu con senno! 138 S’io dico ’l ver, l’effetto nol nasconde.
query.error: **English:** 136 Now be joyful, for you have good luck: 137 you are wealthy, you have peace, and you have wisdom! 138 If I speak the truth, the result does not hide it.
query.result: 136 Adyaiva tvam santuṣṭā bhava, yataḥ tava śubhāni lakṣaṇāni santi: 137 Tvam dhanavatī, tvam śāntimatī, tvam prajñāvatī ca asi! 138 Yadi aham satyam bruve, tadā tasya phalam na gūḍham asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Atene e Lacedemona, che fenno 140 l’antiche leggi e furon sì civili, 141 fecero al viver bene un picciol cenno
query.error: **English:** 139 Athens and Lacedaemon, which made 140 the ancient laws and were so civilized, 141 made only a small gesture toward the good life
query.result: 139 Aṭhēnē ca Lākēdamōna ca, yau cakratuḥ 140 pūrvaśāsanāni ca āsītām ātmavat, 141 cakratuḥ jīvanasya śubhasya ekaṃ saṃjñām

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 verso di te, che fai tanto sottili 143 provedimenti, ch’a mezzo novembre 144 non giugne quel che tu d’ottobre fili.
query.error: **English:** 142 towards you, who make such subtle 143 provisions, that by mid-November 144 does not arrive what you spin in October.
query.result: 142 tava prati, yaḥ evam sūkṣmāṇi 143 upāyān karoṣi, yathā kārttika-māsa-madhye 144 na prāpnoti tat, yat tvam āśvina-māse prakalayasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Quante volte, del tempo che rimembre, 146 legge, moneta, officio e costume 147 hai tu mutato, e rinovate membre!
query.error: **English:** 145 How many times, since the time that you remember, 146 have you changed laws, currency, officials, and customs, 147 and renewed your limbs!
query.result: 145 Yāvad ayam kālaḥ smaryate tava, 146 tāvad dharmam, mudrāṃ, adhikārān, ācārāṃś ca katham bahuśaḥ parivarttitaḥ asi, 147 angāni ca punaḥ punaḥ navīkṛtāni asi!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
148 E se ben ti ricordi e vedi lume, 149 vedrai te somigliante a quella inferma 150 che non può trovar posa in su le piume,
query.error: **English:** 148 And if you remember and see clearly, 149 you will see that you are like that sick woman 150 who cannot find rest on her bed,
query.result: 148 Yadi ca smaraṇena prakāśam āpadyase, 149 tadā tvaṃ tasyāṃ vyādhitāyām iva dṛśyase, 150 yā śayyāyāṃ śāntim na vindati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
151 ma con dar volta suo dolore scherma.
query.error: **English:** 151 but tries to alleviate her pain by tossing and turning.
query.result: 151 api tu parivartane eva sva-śūlam vinivartayitum icchati.
